titleStmt.title: Whereas divers disordered people inhabiting amongst us, not regarding the good of this university, and town of Cambridge, do suffer their chanels, streets, and lanes, to lie unpaved, ungravelled, and uncleansed; and do lay their muck, mire, dung, dust, and other filth, in the open streets, or under colledge-walls, church-walls, or in other lanes within the town ...
titleStmt.author: Cambridge (England)

notesStmt.note: An order appointing overseers to enforce sanitary regulations.
At foot of page: Given under our hands and seals, this [blank] of [blank] Ann. Dom. 163[blank].
Title from opening words of text. Publication information from STC.
Reproduction of the original in the Cambridge University Library.
